ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about how to: (1) approach a client's problem, (2) identify a strategy  (3) execute the plan to provide a set of deliverables that would recommend various solutions to meet the client's needs. Ultimately, I learned about teamwork, fundamentals in creating milestones and working with a military combatant command on exploring actions to support DoD requirements related to the Pacific AOR.
This capstone is a great way to get practical experience and build teamwork skills.
Deep dive into the relationship between the PRC and Taiwan and how the United States can work with Taiwan to safeguard its interests in the region

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Admiral Weigold and INDOPACOM were able to connect us with really impressive people for us to interview and chat with. These were people I would have no access to otherwise. Teamwork was also a big strength of this Capstone

Strengths: Admiral Weigold's network of speakers who came to lecture and support us with our project were high-caliber and insightful. 
The communication of INDOPACOM when we asked questions through electronic communication. Project's problem was of timely nature and relevant to current affairs. Instructor's willingness to mentor and give great advice on client-consulting issues. 
Weaknesses: Due to extremely conservative COVID restrictions, students were unable to receive the full experience of the Capstone project. It appeared insensible that certain teams were allowed to travel domestically, while some who also had domestic clients were unable. Expectations of INDOPACOM and project's scope were slightly broad.
The strength is Admiral Weigold. A weakness may have been that perhaps there should have been more guidance from both the client and Admiral Weigold.
Open ended curriculum made it difficult to find direction at times but Admiral Weigold brought in great speakers that helped guide our research

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Admiral Weigold was a great capstone instructor. His experience and connects in the Asia-Pacific region were really insightful and impressive

I would recommend Admiral Weigold's capstone program because Yale does not offer many opportunities for students to work directly with government partners such as the Department of Defense. As the largest employer of the U.S., understanding the DoD's mission and its personnel is critical in all domains of politics, national security and economy. I highly recommend this course to anyone who also searches for an excellent, transparent mentor like Admiral Weigold.
Yes, if you have to do the global capstone this is a great choice.
